article_node.title: Iran to hold call with European nations over nuclear program as sanctions deadline draws closer
article_node.summary: Iran's Foreign Minister is set to hold a conference call with his French, German, and British counterparts to negotiate terms and potentially avoid the reimposition of UN sanctions related to its nuclear program. The discussions come as the deadline for a satisfactory resolution approaches, with the European nations expressing increasing skepticism over Iran's nuclear activities, particularly after Tehran ceased cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency. The situation is further complicated by Iran's threats against the IAEA's director-general and the looming expiration of the 'snapback' mechanism that allows for the reinstatement of sanctions.
